visuallyHiddenText.description:
Text that describes the badge to a screen reader. Use this
if more information is needed to accurately describe
this card to screen reader users.

isContentCentered.description: Sets the content of the card to be centered

children.description: The children list items passed to the component.

dividerStyle.description:
Whether or not the list's child items should have a border color applied.
One of `'none'`, `'standard'`, `'bottom-only'`.

paddingStyle.description:
The padding styling to apply to the child list item content.
One of `'none'`, `'standard'`, `'compact'`.

refCallback.description: Function callback for the ref of the ul.

role.description: Accessibility role of the list, defaults to 'none'. If creating a list with selectable items, pass 'listbox'.

children.description: The content element to be placed inside the list item for display.

hasChevron.description: Whether or not the list item has a disclosure indicator presented.

isSelected.description: Whether or not the list item should have selection styles applied.

isSelectable.description: Whether or not the list item should have styles to indicate the item is selectable.

onSelect.description:
Function callback for when the appropriate click or key action is performed.
Callback contains the javascript evnt and prop metadata, e.g. onSelect(event, metaData)

refCallback.description: Function callback for the ref of the li.

children.description: The children list items passed to the component.

isCollapsed.description: Whether or not the section is collapsed.

isCollapsible.description: Whether or not the section can be collapsed.

level.description: Optionally sets the heading level. One of `1`, `2`, `3`, `4`, `5`, `6`.

onSelect.description:
Function callback for when the appropriate click or key action is performed.
Callback contains the javascript event and prop metadata, e.g. onSelect(event, metaData)

refCallback.description: Function callback passthrough for the ref of the section li.

title.description: Title text to be placed within the section header.

level.description: Optionally sets the heading level. One of `1`, `2`, `3`, `4`, `5`, `6`.

refCallback.description: Function callback passthrough for the ref of the section li.

title.description: Title text to be placed within the section header.

children.description: The children list items passed to the component.

isCollapsed.description: Whether or not the subsection is collapsed.

isCollapsible.description: Whether or not the subsection can be collapsed.

level.description: Optionally sets the heading level. One of `2`, `3`, `4`, `5`, `6`.

onSelect.description:
Function callback for when the appropriate click or key action is performed.
Callback contains the javascript evnt and prop metadata, e.g. onSelect(event, metaData)

refCallback.description: Function callback passthrough for the ref of the section li.

title.description: Title text to be placed within the subsection header.

level.description: Optionally sets the heading level. One of `2`, `3`, `4`, `5`, `6`.

refCallback.description: Function callback passthrough for the ref of the section li.

title.description: Title text to be placed within the subsection header.

children.description: The content to be displayed within the overlay.

isOpen.description: Indicates if the overlay is open.

backgroundStyle.description: The visual theme to be applied to the overlay background. Accepts 'light', 'dark', and 'clear'.

isScrollable.description: Indicates if the overlay content is scrollable.

onRequestClose.description: Callback triggered on overlay click or ESC key. Setting this enables close behavior.

isRelativeToContainer.description: Indicates if the overlay is relative to the triggering container.

rootSelector.description: Used to select the root mount DOM node. This is used to help prevent focus from shifting outside of the overlay when it is opened in a portal.

zIndex.description: Z-Index layer to apply to the ModalContent and ModalOverlay. Valid values are '100', '6000', '7000', '8000', or '9000'.
